header.style: fixed top-0 w-full z-50 bg-[#0B1120] text-white flex items-center px-6 shadow-md

sidebar_left.style: bg-white border-r border-slate-200 h-full overflow-y-auto p-4 flex flex-col gap-6

sidebar_right.style: bg-white border-l border-slate-200 h-full overflow-y-auto p-4

charts.style: minimalist, no grid lines, precise tooltips

ui_primitives.modifications: Rounded-sm for enterprise feel, dense spacing

mock_data_requirements.assets: Generate 50-100 mock assets with lat/lng (clustered around a city like London or NY), TIV (Total Insured Value), Occupancy Type (Retail, Industrial, etc.), and Flood Risk Score.
mock_data_requirements.kpi_metrics: Total GIV ($5.2B), Total PnL (-$12M), Impacted GIV ($1.1B), Impacted PnL (-$4.5M), Asset Count (142)

instructions_to_main_agent: 2. Create a 'Layout' component that implements the 12-column grid.
3. Build the 'MapComponent' using react-leaflet. Ensure it handles window resizing correctly.
4. Implement the 'KPIBar' as a floating or fixed element just below the header or within the main content top area.
5. Use 'Barlow Condensed' for all numeric values and headings to give it that 'Fintech/Analytics' look.
6. The 'Flood Layer' should be a toggleable Polygon layer on the map using the specific colors provided.
7. Ensure the Left Panel has a 'Collapsible' trigger to maximize map space.
9. MOCK DATA IS CRITICAL. Create a robust 'mockData.js' file with realistic insurance values.
10. Do not use gradients for the header, stick to solid #0B1120.
UNIVERSAL_GUIDELINES_FOR_MAIN_AGENT: Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients
Don't make generic centered layouts, simplistic gradients, and uniform styling.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur) for floating panels over the map.
You MUST NOT apply universal transition. Eg: transition: all. This results in breaking transforms.
You MUST NOT center align the app container.
Always use modern button styles like pill-shaped, or sharp button with interaction animations.
NEVER: use AI assistant Emoji characters like ðŸ¤–ðŸ§  etc for icons.
Every interaction needs micro-animations - hover states, transitions.
Use 2-3x more spacing than feels comfortable in the marketing sections, but KEEP IT DENSE for the Dashboard.
Prioritize using pre-existing components from src/components/ui when applicable.
